1.text: My breath is corrupt, my days are extinct, the graves are mine.

2.text: Are there not mockers around me? and doth [not] mine eye abide in their provocation?

3.text: Lay down now [a pledge], be thou surety for me with thyself: who is he that striketh hands with me?

4.text: For thou hast hidden their heart from understanding; therefore thou wilt not exalt [them].

5.text: He that betrayeth friends for a preyâ€”even the eyes of his children shall fail.

6.text: And he hath made me a proverb of the peoples; and I am become one to be spit on in the face.

7.text: And mine eye is dim by reason of grief, and all my members are as a shadow.

8.text: Upright men [shall be] astonished at this, and the innocent shall be stirred up against the ungodly;

9.text: But the righteous shall hold on his way, and he that hath clean hands shall increase in strength.

10.text: But as for you all, pray come on again; and I shall not find one wise man among you.

11.text: My days are past, my purposes are broken off, the cherished thoughts of my heart.

12.text: They change the night into day; the light [they imagine] near in presence of the darkness.

13.text: If I wait, Sheol is my house; I spread my bed in the darkness:

14.text: I cry to the grave, Thou art my father! to the worm, My mother, and my sister!

15.text: And where is then my hope? yea, my hope, who shall see it?

16.text: It shall go down to the bars of Sheol, when [our] rest shall be together in the dust.
